ygData.subject: RE: Clouding
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I would say that s usually the reason.  But there *is* something more to this whole invis thing.  I ve been aggroed on by a shin knight in LGuk that I
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 15 Feb 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> I had this happen to me doing corpse recovery. From what I could gather it
> caused several casualties among surprised players while I was there. Best
> we could figure, the original train to the zone included a mob or more that
> could cast see invis. As these mobs filed back from the zone they were
> apparently casting see invis on the usual 'pit' mobs.

I would say that's usually the reason. But there *is*
something more to this whole invis thing. I've been aggroed
on by a shin knight in LGuk that I specifically /conned as
indifferent due to my invis before walking through him.
That's why I said I think there's a faction thing tied in with
all this. I also had a similar experience with some red mobs
long ago (don't remember the details). They were ready to
attack while I was visible, and ready to attack while I was
invisible. I played Carrilon, which took me to threatening or
dubious while visible. I then made myself invisible, and
suddenly they were indifferent.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
